But the performance of the promised favour was either attended with so much delay‚ or accompanied with so many unequal con- ditions, that the fidelity of Baffianus was alienated rather than secured by the honourable distinotion which he had obtained. His nomination had been ratified by the consent of Licinius, and that artful prinee, by the means of his emissaries, soon contrived to enter into a secret and dangerous correspondence with the new Caesar, to irritate his discontents, and to urge him to the rash enterprise of extorting by violence what he might in vain solicit from the justice of Constantine. But the vigilant emperor dis- covered the conspiracy before it was ripe for execution; and, after solemnly renouncing the alliance of Bassianus, despoiled him of the purple, and inHiCted ὼε] deserved punishment on his treason and ingratitude.
